input_text:
Job Title: Associate I, Logistics

Location: Miami, FL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Position Summary: 

The core of the job functions include the proper and timely execution of product and material receipts, customer order processing, product packaging, and warehouse management/functions; along with the safe and efficient movement of materials through the warehouse system, while adhering to other business requirements within the Distribution Department. Incumbent will also be responsible for daily coordination and communication with Customer Service to ensure finished goods are delivered in accordance with customer expectations.

Duties and Responsibilities:

Maintains regular and consistent attendance and punctuality.Ensures quality by continually reviewing work to detect and correct errors.Responsible for the daily distribution of temperature sensitive products (domestically) in accordance with GMP/GTP Requirements and Regulatory Guidelines.Responsible for the accurate, timely, and complete shipment of customer orders while adhering to company policies, SOPs, and GMP/GTP Regulatory Guidelines.Responsible for shipping wet lab (Research Tissue) orders and other miscellaneous marketing collateral/inter-departmental shipments.Coordinate with Customer Service to plan and track the shipment of human tissue final products according to customer requirements. Perform a range of packaging, shipping, receiving and inventory control duties; including loading and unloading of trailers, replenishing stock, filling orders, providing inventory services, and completing required documentation of product movement.Receive, inspect, and reconcile all manufactured human tissue finished products from QA to commercial availability. Perform pre-packaging and labeling of PROKERA® Product Boxes and FLO Product Boxes.Maintain logs and records of warehouse stock via weekly cycle counting of finished goods and raw materials.Weekly preparation of inter-company FedEx Shipments.Coordinate, execute and maintain TissueTech’s reverse logistics both via physical returns and within the ERP system. Provide support to internal customers, such as: Quality, Production, R&D, Supply Chain, Finance, Facilities, HR, Customer Service, and Marketing Teams.Responsible for other projects and duties as assigned.

Characteristics Task and their Frequencies:

% of the Time

Description

40%

Distribution Functions (Order Processing, packing, and inspecting)

40%

Inventory Management/Control, Material Handling/Storage, Warehouse Management

15%

Assembly, labeling, packing functions

5%

Other projects and duties as assigned (i.e. Product Inspections)

Position Expertise/Qualifications:

Education- High School Diploma Required.Experience:

Minimum Years Of Experience

Type of Experience

Required/Preferred

Minimum 1 Year

Distribution

Required

Minimum 1 Year

Material Handling

Required

Minimum 1Year

Customer Service

Required

Language: Fluent in English (Oral/Written).Computer Proficiency: Proficient in Microsoft software applications: Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Outlook.Communication (Oral/Written): Excellent ability to communicate clearly and concisely.Understand and follow safety guidelines: Ability to follow verbal direction, ability to understand written policies and guidelines, specifications and safety standards.Inventory and order selection systems: Familiarity with computerized inventory and order selection systems.Equipment handling: knowledge of equipment maintenance, ability to operate required material handling equipment, ability to work in accordance with quality, safety, and sanitation standards, policies and guidelines, a plus.% of Travel: As required by the Distribution Department.Familiarity with American Association of Tissue Banks, Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP), and Hazardous Analysis preferred.Knowledge of international shipping.Basic Math Skills.Problem-solving skills.Decision Making ability.Organizational skills.Procedural Mindset.Ability to prioritize.Understanding of Quality Management Principles.Flexibility to work overtime as required, possible weekends, and holidays even on short notice. Forklift Operator Certification or ability to obtain certification is preferred.

About BioTissue & Our Culture

At BioTissue, we transform the gift of life by sharing miracles. We are a diverse community, where talent and teamwork are core to who we are. Here, you are EMPOWERED to do the work you love, be yourself, and make an impact. Resilient and committed to our vision, we embrace challenges, celebrate courage, and take great pride in our work to create life-changing products.

Purpose led us here. Passion and legacy keep us going.

ADA Statement

Candidates who cannot perform one or more of these requirements due to disability will be eligible for consideration based on whether the candidate can perform the position’s essential functions with reasonable accommodations.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
